properties.areaDesc: South Mountain/Ahwatukee; North Phoenix/Glendale; Buckeye/Avondale; East Valley; Northwest Valley; Central Phoenix; Deer Valley; Southeast Valley/Queen Creek; Scottsdale/Paradise Valley
properties.headline: Freeze Watch issued February 3 at 1:20AM MST until February 5 at 9:00AM MST by NWS Phoenix AZ
properties.description:
* WHAT...For the first Freeze Watch, temperatures in the lower
30s possible. For the second Freeze Watch, temperatures in the
lower 30s possible.

* WHERE...North Phoenix/Glendale, Scottsdale/Paradise Valley,
Buckeye/Avondale, Deer Valley, Central Phoenix, The East
Valley of the Phoenix Metro Area, Southeast Valley/Queen
Creek, South Mountain/Ahwatukee and The Northwest Valley of
the Phoenix Metro Area.

* WHEN...For the first Freeze Watch, from late tonight through
Tuesday morning. For the second Freeze Watch, from Tuesday
evening through Wednesday morning.

* IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions could kill crops, other
sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor
plumbing.
properties.instruction:
Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent
freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should
be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have
in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above-
ground pipes to protect them from freezing.

NWSheadline: FREEZE WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... ...FREEZE WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING
